error.signature: ImportError: DLL load failed while importing X
error.regex: ImportError: DLL load failed|ImportError.*cannot open shared object|libstdc\+\+.*not found

verdict.summary: Shared library (.so/.dll) not found. Missing system dependency or wrong architecture.

dead_ends.why_fails: Usually not a Python issue â€” it's a missing system library
DLLs are architecture-specific and may have dependencies

workarounds.action: Install the missing system library: apt install libXXX-dev
workarounds.how:
# Check what's missing:
ldd /path/to/module.so | grep 'not found'

workarounds.action: For conda environments, install with conda which bundles system libs
On Windows, install Visual C++ Redistributable
workarounds.how:
# Download from https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe
# Or install via winget:
winget install Microsoft.VCRedist.2015+.x64

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'ImportError' is a import_error error while 'ModuleNotFoundError' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
